recipe.name: Prosciutto Wrapped Chicken and Scalloped Potatoes (One Pan!)
recipe.description: This is one of those recipes that is easy enough for midweek but elegant enough for company - at least, in my opinion! By baking the chicken on top of the potato, the juices mingles with the salty prosciutto then drips down onto the potato, adding extra (serious) flavour oomph!
recipeIngredient: Zest of 1 small lemon (, or 1/2 large lemon)
1 1/2 tsp finely sliced fresh sage leaves ((Note 1))
4  chicken thigh fillets (, skinless and boneless (about 5 - 7 oz / 150 - 200g each))
4 long or 8 small   thin slices of prosciutto
1.5 lb / 750 g   potatoes (, peeled and cut into thin slices)
1 1/2 tbsp olive oil + 1/2 tbsp extra olive oil

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together the Ricotta Filling ingredients in a small bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix together the Ricotta Filling ingredients in a small bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Lay out the prosciutto on a work surface. Place chicken lengthwise at the bottom of each strip.
recipeInstructions.name: Lay out the prosciutto on a work surface. Place chicken lengthwise at the bottom of each strip.

recipeInstructions.text: Divide Ricotta Filling between the chicken, placing it at the bottom (closest to you).
recipeInstructions.name: Divide Ricotta Filling between the chicken, placing it at the bottom (closest to you).

recipeInstructions.text: Roll up the chicken, wrapping it in the prosciutto, finishing with the seam side down. Not too tightly otherwise the ricotta will ooze out!
recipeInstructions.name: Roll up the chicken, wrapping it in the prosciutto, finishing with the seam side down. Not too tightly otherwise the ricotta will ooze out!

recipeInstructions.text: Use toothpicks to seal the ends. (Note 2)
recipeInstructions.name: Use toothpicks to seal the ends. (Note 2)

recipeInstructions.text: Spread the potato slices on the base of a roasting dish or large ovenproof skillet. Fan them out so they are overlapping slightly.
recipeInstructions.name: Spread the potato slices on the base of a roasting dish or large ovenproof skillet. Fan them out so they are overlapping slightly.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together 1 1/2 tbsp olive oil and garlic then pour over the potatoes, using a teaspoon or brush to spread it out. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and thyme leaves.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix together 1 1/2 tbsp olive oil and garlic then pour over the potatoes, using a teaspoon or brush to spread it out. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and thyme leaves.

recipeInstructions.text: Place chicken on top of the potato, drizzle the chicken with 1/2 tbsp olive oil and bake for 40 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Place chicken on top of the potato, drizzle the chicken with 1/2 tbsp olive oil and bake for 40 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove chicken onto a plate to rest, covered loosely with foil.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove chicken onto a plate to rest, covered loosely with foil.

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle the potatoes with parmesan cheese, then return just the potatoes back into the oven and turn up the oven to maximum. Bake for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Sprinkle the potatoes with parmesan cheese, then return just the potatoes back into the oven and turn up the oven to maximum. Bake for 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove potatoes from the oven. Place chicken back on top.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove potatoes from the oven. Place chicken back on top.

review.reviewBody: Easier than you think….even without a video. The best surprise is how good the flavours seep into the potatoes! So easy, all in the oven and pairs well with the Spinach, Roast Pumpkin & Pine Nut salad.

Yum yum yum. Easy no mess,
Didn’t have ricotta as it was a last minute decision to make it so used cream cheese instead.
Yumyumyum
Another delicious meal, thank you. Love your recipes and website so much so I've just received your Dinner book and am looking forward to my pre ordered copy of Tonight.

So good! And Sooo easy!  I added a little shredded parm and finely chopped chives to the ricotta mixture.
This recipe tastes like it took hours to make but literally took a few minutes! And hubby LOVED it!  Thanks again for all of these incredible recipes!

Prosciutto wrapped chicken w scalloped potatoes, what a wonderful lunch, we so enjoyed it.  Thank you so much Nagi for all your efforts. Your fantastic recipes  are keeping us afloat during this difficult time here in time UK.

Ett another goooood recipe👏 The lemon zest in the filling makes for that special touch! Sage however I just can’t stand so I used fresh oregano instead. I might have miscalculated the amount of potatoes and  spread the slices a bit too thinly, so some of them got a bit too crispy, but since I made this for myself that didn’t matter because I love crispy😊 The next time I make this I think I’m going to add something saucy, like either a cold sauce or some coleslaw-like salad.

What a great recipe! I made a variation, adding finely chopped rosemary ham and egg yolk to the ricotta mixture and au gratin potatoes (using milk, cream, and shredded Asiago) to add some creaminess. We will definitely be having this again. Thanks for the inspiration!
